info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 6 at 8:27PM CDT by NWS Nashville TN
info.description:
...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Tennessee...
Buffalo River Above Flat Woods affecting Wayne and Perry Counties.
For the Buffalo River...including Lobelville, Flat Woods...elevated river levels are forecast.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Buffalo River above Flat Woods.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 18 feet, Areas along the river continue to be inundated, including access points, agricultural land, and properties on Big Buffalo Estates Cir. Water begins to cover portions of Buffalo Bottom Rd, River Bluff Rd, and Duncans Camp Rd near Old Hwy 13, and approaches Old Hwy 13 at Big Buffalo Estates, and McGee Rd which may be impassable at higher levels.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 18.5 feet and steady. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 15 feet. - Flood stage is 22 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
Monday afternoon at 230 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
